intro: Cyrtandra pickeringii var. honolulensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the island of Oahu in Hawaii. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glossy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
